NATIONAL NEWS






Natural gas bills may rise



May 15--The Owensboro City Commission is considering doubling the city's natural gas franchise fee, a pass-through charge to customers that could generate an additional $250,000 that city leaders hope to devote to economic development. The city has negotiated a tentative franchise agreement with Atmos Energy, which serves more than 22,000 customers in Owensboro, to raise the fee to 2 percent for ...


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



SDG&E selects two 'peaker' plant bids



May 15--San Diego Gas & Electric Co. announced Monday that it has signed agreements with two companies that will build small "peaker" electricity plants to kick on only during periods of high energy demand.  The proposed plants, scheduled to be on-line by 2008, would be built at the utility's Pala substation in North County and next to an SDG&E substation in southern Orange County, according to a ...


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Nuke plant guards cheated: Federal probe says security bosses at Shearon Harris gave answers to tests



May 15--Federal investigators have concluded that three contract security supervisors handed out answers to guards taking annual recertification tests at Shearon Harris Nuclear Plant in southern Wake County.  As a result, numerous guards were not tested or properly qualified in 2005 to protect the Progress Energy-owned nuclear plant, Nuclear Regulatory Commission inspectors said.


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Wind-power skeptics shift direction



May 15--A pair of wind-energy skeptics on the board of the state's largest utility have backed down from their recent push for the company to drop support for a proposed Fire Island wind farm.  Instead, the skeptics -- board vice-chair Uwe Kalenka and newly elected board member Alex Gimarc -- said they will support an "appropriate and prudent" investigation of wind power at Fire Island, as well ...


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Snafu puts power plant zoning back on council table



May 15--WATERLOO -- A procedural blunder will force Waterloo City Council members once again to vote on the Elk Run Energy Station coal-fired power plant. Council members had voted unanimously last week following a five-hour public hearing to approve annexing land and zoning it for the controversial $1.3 million power plant on the northeast side of the city.


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Equitable - Dominion deal clears hurdle



May 15--U.S. District Court Judge Arthur J. Schwab on Monday tossed out the Federal Trade Commission's lawsuit to halt Equitable Resources Inc.'s planned acquisition of Dominion Peoples Gas, saying the state Public Utility Commission's recent approval of the deal holds precedence.  In a 19-page opinion, Schwab noted that the PUC determined the acquisition would allow the natural-gas distribution ...


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Company applies to build electric plant in Wendell



May 15--WENDELL -- A company that announced in 2005 that it would build a renewable-energy plant that could convert animal waste into electricity has applied for a permit to build.  But it won't be a renewable-energy plant. EnviroDyne Corp. plans to build a natural gas-based plant on 156 acres of what's now agricultural land southwest of Wendell. According to the 98-page application with the ...


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Copper stolen from utility poles



May 15--MASARYKTOWN -- She almost didn't see it.  Joy Weld stepped outside to retrieve her paper last Saturday morning and noticed something odd about the utility pole standing beside her chain link fence. Six feet of the ground wire running up the pole had been snipped off. "I just happened to look over and saw it was missing a piece," said Weld, 73, who lives on Monroe Avenue.


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Everything's coming up green



May 15--Fayette County Community Action Agency has opened the first green building in Uniontown.  "People have been asking me, 'What the heck is a green building?'," said James Stark, the CEO of Fayette County Community Action Agency. It's another name for an environmentally friendly building designed to cut operation costs and reduce carbon emissions and other waste that could be hazardous to ...


May 15, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News





A first look at flood devastation



MISSOURI VALLEY, IOWA - Rachel and Ryan Rempel spotted their little red porch just after 2 p.m. Sunday. Alice Wede saves what she can Sunday from her house in Missouri Valley, Iowa. Today, residents will be let in again, and the city will start cleaning streets and assessing road damage. It had broken off their house and floated into a field across the street.

ONEOK to Hold Its 2007 Annual Meeting of Shareholders



TULSA, Okla., May 14 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- ONEOK, Inc. (NYSE: OKE) will hold its annual meeting of shareholders on May 17, 2007, at 10 a.m., Central Daylight Time. May 15, 2007 Internet Wire



Bird Watching is Just a Click Away on Great River Energy's Website



ELK RIVER, Minn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--A pair of peregrine falcons has made its home in a man-made nesting box atop Great River Energys Elk River Station. Bird watchers can view the pair by visiting the Great River Energy bird cam at www.greatriverenergy.com. The falcons and their soon-to-be-hatched chicks are expected to remain in the nesting box until mid-summer.


May 14, 2007 Business Wire





Duke Energy CFO Hauser Exercises Options for 103,600 Shares



NEW YORK (AP) - The chief financial officer of Duke Energy Corp. exercised options for 103,600 shares of common stock, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing Friday. In a Form 4 filed with the SEC, David Hauser reported he exercised options for the shares Thursday for $7.85 to $16.90 apiece and then sold all of them Thursday for $20.30 to $20.38 apiece.


May 14, 2007 Canadian Business Magazine



CPS Energy gains addition 240 megawatts of wind energy



San Antonio businesses and consumers now have access to an additional source of renewable energy. CPS Energy is tapping into a new 240-megawatt source of wind-generated electricity. Some 180 new wind turbines at the Cottonwood Creek Wind Farm that were under construction since last year have come online. The wind farm is located just southwest of Sweetwater, Texas.


May 14, 2007 San Antonio Business Journal



Consumer inertia leads to high gas prices



Half the population are paying up to 250 a year more for their gas and electricity because the power companies know they will never switch supplier, it was claimed yesterday.A report by the Centre for Competition Policy at the University of East Anglia concluded that a lack of competition in the market is effectively allowing the six big power firms to keep bills artificially high for the 50% of ...


May 15, 2007 Guardian Unlimited



Green group questions WA Govt's climate change spending



Green group Environs Kimberley says the Western Australian Government's climate change package is 'inadequate' and reveals a serious gap in efforts to address the threat. The Government has announced it will spend more than $100 million over the next five years implementing the package. The package includes a range of measures aimed at boosting the state's renewable energy sector and encouraging ...

Nuclear Power Generation Is an Established Part of the World's Electricity Mix Providing Over 16% of World Electricity



AM Eastern Daylight Time DUBLIN, Ireland--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Research and Markets (http://www.researchandmarkets.com/reports/c56722) has announced the addition of Global Nuclear Power Industry to their offering. Nuclear power is generated using Uranium, which is a metal mined in various parts of the world. Presently, nuclear power produces around 15% of the world's energy needs, and produces huge ...


May 14, 2007 Business Wire



Finavera Renewables Submits 366 Megawatts of Wind Projects into the British Columbia Environmental Assessment Process



VANCOUVER, Canada--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Finavera Renewables Inc. (the Company or Finavera Renewables) (TSX VENTURE:FVR) is pleased to announce it has entered four wind power projects into the British Columbia Environmental Assessment (EA) process. The four projects are located in the provinces Peace Region and have a nominal nameplate capacity of 366 megawatts (MW).

City Capital's Goshen Energy Pumping Gas on West Delta Well Number One -- First Full Flow Since Katrina



City Capital Corporation's (OTCBB: CCCN)  City Capital Corporation's (OTCBB: CCCN) wholly owned subsidiary, Goshen Energy Resources, has initiated production with the first of four wells in the West Delta 25 gas producing offshore platform.
